meanings.definition: Complaining or murmuring in a low, discontented way.
meanings.sent1: The grumbling child refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent2: She was in a grumbling mood after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The grumbling cat demanded more treats with a frown.
meanings.sent4: The grumbling thunder warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: His grumbling voice filled the room with dissatisfaction.

meanings.sent1: The grumbling of the distant thunder could be heard.
meanings.sent2: The engine made a grumbling noise as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The grumbling of the old pipes kept the house awake at night.
meanings.sent4: The grumbling of the hungry stomachs echoed in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent5: The grumbling of the volcano signaled an imminent eruption.
